security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate research tool that makes HTTP requests to the Dify API and loads environment configuration. The code behavior matches the stated purpose. No obfuscation, credential exfiltration, or suspicious network patterns detected.

medium_findings.title: Environment variable loading from multiple paths
medium_findings.description: The script loads .env files from three potential locations including the current working directory. While this is common practice for configuration, users should ensure no sensitive credentials are accidentally committed to version control. Code: `dotenv.config({ path: envPath })` at lines 17-18 loads configuration from project root, skills directory, or deepresearch directory.

low_findings.title: API key logged in error messages
low_findings.description: The script logs the API base URL to stderr: `console.error('[Dify Client] Connecting to ${this.config.baseUrl}...')` at line 118. While not logging the actual API key, error messages at lines 292-294 could expose configuration issues. Users should review logging in production environments.

content.user_title: Research any topic with AI-powered workflow
content.value_statement: Finding comprehensive information for complex coding tasks takes significant time and effort. This skill automates research by calling a Dify workflow that searches documentation, analyzes topics with DeepSeek Reasoner, and generates structured implementation guides with code examples.
actual_capabilities: Searches official documentation, tutorials, and academic resources via Dify workflow
Analyzes coding tasks with DeepSeek Reasoner for deep insights
Generates structured implementation guides with dependencies and code
Returns task analysis with knowledge gaps and technology requirements
Supports configurable research depth from quick (1) to comprehensive (5)
Provides sources and verification commands for implemented solutions
limitations: Requires a Dify API key and configured Dify workflow endpoint
Research quality depends on the underlying Dify workflow configuration
External API calls may incur costs and depend on Dify service availability
Cannot access private or proprietary documentation behind authentication

best_practices: Set DIFY_API_KEY in your .env file before running research queries
Start with depth level 1-2 for simple topics and increase to 3-5 for complex implementations
Review the generated implementation guide and verify all code with tests before deploying
anti_patterns: Do not rely on research output without verifying against official documentation
Avoid using this skill for topics requiring real-time or breaking-change information
Do not skip environment configuration validation before running complex research queries

faq.question: Is Dify free to use?
faq.answer: Dify offers both free and paid plans. Check dify.ai for current pricing and API rate limits.

faq.question: What research depth should I use?
faq.answer: Use depth 1-2 for simple lookups, 3 for standard research, and 4-5 for complex architectural decisions.

faq.question: Can I use this with self-hosted Dify?
faq.answer: Yes. Set DIFY_BASE_URL to your self-hosted Dify instance endpoint in your environment configuration.

faq.question: Is my research data sent to third parties?
faq.answer: Research queries are sent to your configured Dify endpoint. Review your Dify provider's data handling policies.

faq.question: Research is returning errors. What should I check?
faq.answer: Verify DIFY_API_KEY is set, DIFY_BASE_URL is correct, and your Dify workflow is properly configured and published.

faq.question: How does this compare to regular web search?
faq.answer: This tool provides structured, AI-analyzed research with code examples rather than simple web search results.
